resources.string: MaterialYou Catalog
Material3 Catalog
Snackbars show short updates about app processes at the bottom of the screen.
Progress indicators inform users about the status of ongoing processes, such as loading an app or submitting a form.
Use typography to make writing legible and beautiful. Material\'s default type scale includes contrasting and flexible styles to support a wide range of use cases.

Chips can show multiple interactive elements together in the same area, such as a list of selectable movie times, or a series of email contacts. There are four types of chips: assist, filter, input, and suggestion.
Jetpack Compose is not yet available.
Buttons help people initiate actions, from sending an email, to sharing a document, to liking a post.
Cards contain content and actions that relate information about a subject.
Text fields allow users to enter text into a UI. They typically appear in forms and dialogs.
Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values.
Navigation rails provide access to primary destinations in apps when using tablet and desktop screens.
Top app bars display information and actions at the top of a screen.\nA bottom app bar displays navigation and key actions at the bottom of mobile screens.
Dialogs provide important prompts in a user flow.
AnimatedVisibility is used when animating content change in layout and animating appearance / disappearance.
AnimateAsState is used when it is state-based and happens during composition, animating single values and animation is finite.
AnimatedContent is used when animating content change in layout and swapping content based on state.
UpdateTransition is used when it is state-based and happens during composition. It is animating multiple values simultaneously and animation is finite.
Tooltips are informative, specific, and action-oriented text labels that provide contextual support
Badges convey dynamic information, such as counts or status. A badge can include labels or numbers.
Date pickers let people select a date, or a range of dates.
Search allows users to enter a keyword or phrase and get relevant information. Itâ€™s an alternative to other forms of navigation.
Rich tooltips bring attention to a particular element of feature that warrants the user\'s focus. It supports multiple lines of informational text.
Tabs organize content across different screens and views
Column and Row are two of the most basic layout components in Jetpack Compose. They are used to arrange child composables in either a vertical or horizontal order.

The Box layout is a simple layout that stacks its children in a single row or column, depending on the axis specified. It is a very versatile layout that can be used to create a variety of layouts, such as buttons, images, and text.
